intro: Eithea lagopaivae, commonly known as the Socotra starling, is a unique plant native to the island of Socotra. It is characterized by its distinctive, star-shaped flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is adapted to the arid and rugged terrain of its native habitat. Its foliage is typically small and leathery, providing a degree of drought resistance. Due to its limited distribution and ecological significance, it is considered a rare and vulnerable species.
